<title><![CDATA[Schoolboy Q Teams Up with Kanye West for "THat Part"]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/schoolS_2.jpg' alt='Schoolboy Q Teams Up with Kanye West for "THat Part"' /><br/><br/>It's been a busy day for <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/schoolboy_q">Schoolboy Q</a>. Not only did the rapper announce he would be <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/nxne_adds_schoolboy_q_land_of_talk_born_ruffians">playing Toronto's NXNE fest</a>, he's just dropped a new track with none other than Kanye West.<br/>
<br/>
Following last month's <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/schoolboy_q_returns_with_groovy_tony">"Groovy Tony,"</a> the new joint collab is called "THat Part." And, yes, that "h" is intentionally capped.<br/>
<br/>
Right now, you can grab the song <a href="https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/that-part-feat.-kanye-west/id1112764699?app=iTunes&amp;ign-mpt=uo%3D4" target="_blank">here</a> on iTunes or stream it over <a href="https://rudeboyy.com/2016/05/12/schoolboy-q-ft-kanye-west-that-part/" target="_blank">here</a>.<br/>
<br/>
So far there's still no word on when Schoolboy Q will follow up 2014's <a href="http://exclaim.ca/Reviews/HipHop/schoolboy_q-oxymoron"><i>Oxymoron</i></a>, but we're guessing it won't be before long.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/ExclaimCaAllArticles/~4/d0kDM1M5UQ8" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[http://exclaim.ca/music/article/schoolboy_q_teams_up_with_kanye_west_for_that_part]]></guid>

<title><![CDATA[Chance the Rapper Drops 'Coloring Book' Mixtape]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/chance3thum.jpg' alt='Chance the Rapper Drops 'Coloring Book' Mixtape' /><br/><br/>We knew <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/chance_rapper">Chance the Rapper</a> was gearing up to release his<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/chance_the_rapper_teases_chance_3"> third mixtape</a> this week, and it's finally arrived. Officially titled <em>Coloring Book</em>, the 14-song offering is available as of tonight (May 12) over at <a href="https://itun.es/us/C3Qwcb">Apple Music</a>.<br/>
<br/>
It marks Chance's first fully solo offering since 2013's<a href="http://exclaim.ca/Reviews/HipHop/chance_rapper-acid_rap"> <em>Acid Rap</em></a>, and as anticipated, the new mixtape features recently shared cuts <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/chance_the_rapper_releasing_chance_3_next_week_premieres_blessings_on_fallon">"Blessings,"</a> <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/chance_the_rapper-no_problem_ft_2_chainz_and_lil_wayne">"No Problem" </a>featuring 2 Chainz and Lil Wayne, and <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/chance_the_rapper-angels_ft_saba_video">"Angels"</a> featuring Saba.<br/>
<br/>
There are plenty more high-profile guest appearances on the latest offering from the Chicago rapper, too. Kanye West helps open the album with "All We Got," Young Thug and Lil Yachty hop on "Mixtape," Justin Bieber and Towkio feature on "Juke Jam," while Jeremih, Jay Electronica, Future, T-Pain and more also deliver guest spots. See the complete cameo-packed tracklisting below.<br/>
<br/>
Once you've caught up on all of the collaborative credits, give the entire tape a preview in the player at the bottom of the page.<br/>
<br/>
<em>Coloring Book</em>:<br/>
<br/>
1. All We Got (ft. Kanye West & Chicago Children's Choir)<br/>
2. No Problem (ft. Lil Wayne & 2 Chainz)<br/>
3. Summer Friends (ft. Jeremih & Francis & The Lights)<br/>
4. D.R.A.M. Sings Special<br/>
5. Blessings<br/>
6. Same Drugs<br/>
7. Mixtape (ft. Young Thug & Lil Yachty)<br/>
8. Angels (ft. Saba)<br/>
9. Juke Jam (ft. Justin Bieber & Towkio)<br/>
10. All Night (ft. Knox Fortune)<br/>
11. How Great (ft. Jay Electronica & My cousin Nicole)<br/>
12. Smoke Break (ft. Future)<br/>
13. Finish Line/Drown (ft. T-Pain, Kirk Franklin, Eryn Allen Kane & Noname)<br/>
14. Blessings<br/>
<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Car Seat Headrest LPs Destroyed over Uncleared Cars Sample]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/carS1.jpg' alt='Car Seat Headrest LPs Destroyed over Uncleared Cars Sample' /><br/><br/>While <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/car_seat_headrest">Car Seat Headrest</a>'s <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/car_seat_headrest-drunk_drivers_killer_whales_video"> Teens of Denial</a> </em> arrives May 20 as a digital download, a copyright mixup stemming from the sampling of an old song by new wave group <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/cars">the Cars</a> means that the original vinyl pressing will be recalled and destroyed. Physical copies with an alternate version of the track will be released later this summer.<br/>
<br/>
A <a href="http://matablog.matadorrecords.com/2016/05/12/an-announcement-regarding-car-seat-headrests-teens-of-denial/" target="_blank">statement</a> from <a href="http://www.matadorrecords.com/" target="_blank">Matador Records</a> explains that they had believed to have obtained the rights to include a snippet of the Cars' "Just What I Needed" for Car Seat Headrest's "Just What I Wanted/Not Just What I Needed." Unfortunately, it turns out that the publisher they had been dealing with did not actually have the rights to the older radio hit. Furthermore, Cars songwriter Ric Ocasek isn't interested in having his song attached to Car Seat Headrest leader Will Toledo's new tune.<br/>
<br/>
The label explained: "Matador had negotiated for a licence in good faith months ago, only to be told last week that the publisher involved was not authorized to complete the licence in the United States, and that Ric Ocasek preferred that his work not be included in the song."<br/>
<br/>
Toledo added that they weren't trying to pull the wool over anybody's eyes, and that this is a regrettable and untimely situation to be in a week ahead of the record's release.<br/>
<br/>
"I'm not going to get into the nitty-gritty of email chains and invested parties; suffice it to say that Matador (and I) were neither pulling a Banksy nor operating in ignorance of the law," Toledo said, "but that we truly believed we had the issue resolved months ago, until last week."<br/>
<br/>
Toledo explained that he also spent the last couple of days tweaking the cut to be included on next week's digital release, and the forthcoming vinyl edition. It is now simply called "Not What I Needed," and the rearranged composition is "about half a minute longer than the original track, and goes in a much different direction." In a twist of fate, he added that the song is much stronger now.<br/>
<br/>
"I've grown up accustomed to working on an album right up to its drop date, so this is not a freak-out scenario for me," he added. "The album is going to come out on time and it's going to be good."<br/>
<br/>
You can read Toledo and Matador's statements in full over <a href="http://matablog.matadorrecords.com/2016/05/12/an-announcement-regarding-car-seat-headrests-teens-of-denial/">here</a>.<br/>
<br/>

<title><![CDATA[River & Sky Festival Gets Hey Rosetta!, the Sadies, METZ, Beach Fossils for 2016 Edition]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/riverandskyS.jpg' alt='River & Sky Festival Gets Hey Rosetta!, the Sadies, METZ, Beach Fossils for 2016 Edition' /><br/><br/>Returning to the banks of the Sturgeon River for the eighth annual edition, Ontario's <a href="http://www.riverandsky.ca" target="_blank">River & Sky</a> festival has announced the musical lineup for its 2016 event.<br/>
<br/>
This year, the music and camping event will take place from July 14 to 17 on the grounds of Fishers' Paradise (between Sudbury and North Bay), and topping the bill are Hey Rosetta!, Beach Fossils, the Sadies, METZ and Basia Bulat.<br/>
<br/>
Other names within the lineup include Bry Webb & the Providers, the Courtneys, Ought, TOPS, Moss Lime, Darlene Shrugg, Language Arts, Nap Eyes, Samantha Martin and Delta Sugar, Quantum Tangle, Steve Lambke, PHERN, Yonatan Gat, Hurt Protector, Hidden Roots Collective, Dunes, Dirty Princes, Hello Holiday, David Dino White, Barry Miles, Submerged Objects, Josh Turnbull, Night Terrors, Matt Foy, Sik Rik, the Ape-ettes, Annie Sumi and Eric Clancy.<br/>
<br/>
More acts will be announced in the coming weeks.<br/>
<br/>
This year also marks a change in the festival format. Having run three days in the past, organizers have now lined up four days to celebrate indie music in the wilderness. River & Sky 2016 will also yield more workshops and art installations, in addition to the festival's three stages.<br/>
<br/>
"Each year we have 130 or so members helping put on the festival. They've asked for a longer, extended mix of River and Sky," festival director Peter Zwarich said in a statement. "And so this year, we'll have four days of music with great bands from across Canada and the U.S., as well as our regional stars."<br/>
<br/>
Plenty of ticketing options are available, with four-day advance passes available for $180 and three-day passes available for $135. Single day and single night passes are also available, and vary in price based on day.<br/>
<br/>
Further festival and ticketing information can be found through River and Sky's <a href="http://www.riverandsky.ca" target="_blank">official website</a>.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/ExclaimCaAllArticles/~4/CFuRLQeu-GY" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

<title><![CDATA[​The Stone Roses Release New Single]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/stoneroses-sm.jpg' alt='​The Stone Roses Release New Single' /><br/><br/><a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/stone_roses">The Stone Roses</a> have been hinting for a while now that something major is in the works. Last year, after plastering the UK with posters of a lemon logo, the band announced their live return. Now, the mysterious citrus-y posters have returned — and this time, they're marking the arrival of the band's first new song in more than 20 years.<br/>
 <br/>
Frontman Ian Brown <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/stone_roses_are_recording_new_music">confirmed</a> that the group has been recording new music, and now the first listen is set to arrive in the form of a new single later today (May 12). The band announced the news on social media, revealing that the new track would be getting released 8 p.m. GMT (or 3 p.m. EDT).<br/>
 
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p dir="ltr" lang="en">THE STONE ROSES WILL RELEASE A NEW SINGLE TONIGHT AT 8PM <a href="https://t.co/oHYrmgwYYE">pic.twitter.com/oHYrmgwYYE</a></p>
— The Stone Roses (@thestoneroses) <a href="https://twitter.com/thestoneroses/status/730714160472952832">May 12, 2016</a></blockquote>
<script async src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><br/>
It marks the band's first new material since 1994's <em>Second Coming</em>, and according to Brown, the new stuff has been sounding "like a dream."<br/>
 <br/>
The Stone Roses' career was explored a few years back in a documentary dubbed <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/stone_roses_made_of_stone_documentary_gets_north_american_theatrical_run_dvdblu-ray_release">Made of Stone</a></em>. Check back at 3 p.m. EDT to hear the band kick off the next chapter in their career when the new single drops.<br/>
<br/>
<strong>UPDATE (5/12, 3 p.m.): The track has arrived. It's a Paul Epworth-produced song titled "All for One," and you can give it a spin below. You can also purchase it both digitally and as a 7-inch over <a href="http://www.thestoneroses.org/" target="_blank">here</a>. </strong><br/>
<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Chvrches - "Warning Call"]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/chvrcwarningthum.jpg' alt='Chvrches - "Warning Call"' /><br/><br/>To help boost the upcoming <a href="http://www.mirrorsedge.com/" target="_blank"><em>Mirror's Edge Catalyst</em></a> videogame, Scottish band <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/chvrches">Chvrches</a> have uploaded a new tune sung from the perspective of main character, Faith. You'll hear Lauren Mayberry channelling the adventure series figure in the uplifting and anthemic "Warning Call."<br/>
<br/>
The song fits in with the general sparkling electro-pop punch of Chvrches, with a series of '80s keys gelling around a one-two drum machine beat and Mayberry's optimistic cries. As Faith, she sings of holding on for a better tomorrow, dealing with adversity, and looking for a light through the darkness.<br/>
<br/>
"We were honored to be asked to contribute to the soundtrack for <i>Mirror's Edge Catalyst</i>," the group's Iain Cook said in a statement. "The sound of Chvrches' music resonates with the minimalist sci-fi dystopia of the <i>Mirror's Edge</i> world, and we feel that the song complements the drama, emotion and empowering themes of Faith's story."<br/>
<br/>
You can hear Chvrches new tune below, while the videogame gets a North American release on June 7.<br/>
<br/>

<title><![CDATA[MSTRKRFT Return with 'Operator' LP, Premiere New Single with Ian Svenonius]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/mstrfkrftnewthum.jpg' alt='MSTRKRFT Return with 'Operator' LP, Premiere New Single with Ian Svenonius' /><br/><br/>After trotting out their <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/mstrkrft-little_red_hen">"Little Red Hen"</a> single earlier in the year, Jesse Keeler and Al-P have formally announced some big plans for <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/mstrkrft">MSTRKRFT</a>: a new album is coming out this summer. The production duo's first full-length release in seven years is called <i>Operator</i>, and you can dial it all up on July 22 via <a href="http://lastgang.com/" target="_blank">Last Gang Records</a>.<br/>
<br/>
An interview with the band explains that <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/death_from_above_1979">Death From Above 1979</a> bassist Keeler and producer Al-P have been working on <i>Operator</i> since 2013. The 10-song set was inspired by military jargon Keeler had come across online.<br/>
<br/>
"While browsing military related websites and blogs, mostly consisting of vets talking to each other like any civilian I suppose, I noticed repeated reference to something they called 'operator culture,'" he told <a href="http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/dance/7370296/mstrkrft-ends-five-year-hiatus-dance" target="_blank"><i>Billboard</i></a>. "It seemed to be something that was sometimes laughed at, sometimes caused disdain, but was referenced constantly and seemed to be understood by everyone. I came to believe the operator concept is one of detachment."<br/>
<br/>
The collection follows 2009's <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/mstrkrft-fist_of_god"><i>Fist of God</i></a>. While that album featured guest nods from Ghostface Killah and John Legend, MSTRKRFT tapped punk icon and culture critic Ian Svenonius (Chain and the Gang, Nation of Ulysses) to add vocals to <i>Operator</i>'s "Party Line."<br/>
<br/>
Al-P noted that the song had begun as an instrumental, though they quickly realized that the tune "demanded a vocal with a certain swagger."<br/>
<br/>
He continued: "Ian was able re-contextualize the title and make it work with the lyrics he wrote, which became something we connected with personally, and fit perfectly with the entire album as a body of work."<br/>
<br/>
You can hear the sassy, synth-slathered dance track below, where you'll also find the duo's upcoming tour dates.<br/>
<br/>
Tour dates:<br/>
<br/>
06/01 Washington, DC - U Street Music Hall<br/>
06/02 Cambridge, MA - Middle East<br/>
06/04 Chicago, IL - Double Door<br/>
06/08 Denver, CO - Club Vinyl<br/>
06/10 San Francisco, CA -The Independent<br/>
06/11 Los Angeles, CA - Exchange<br/>
06/13 Ottawa, ON - Ritual Nightclub<br/>
06/14 Toronto, ON - The Horseshoe Tavern<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[River Tiber Details 'Indigo,' Shares New Track]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/TiberIndigoThumb.jpg' alt='River Tiber Details 'Indigo,' Shares New Track' /><br/><br/><a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/river_tiber">River Tiber</a> has been hinting upcoming project, <em>Indigo</em>, these past few months with a string of singles. Now, we know when the new LP from the Toronto-based alt-R&B artist will see the light of day.<br/>
<br/>
<em>Indigo</em> will arrive June 24 and will run 12 tracks in length. You can find the tracklist below. As you'll see, the LP includes previously heard cuts <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/river_tiber-no_talk_video">"No Talk"</a> and <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/river_tiber-west_ft_daniel_caesar_video">"West,"</a> which features fellow Torontonian Daniel Caesar.<br/>
<br/>
Along with the album details, the artist also shared new track "Acid Test" through Zane Lowe's Beats 1 Radio show. The album cut makes use of heady keyboards and vocal melodies with a loose, groovy rhythm section punching its way to the forefront every so often.<br/>
<br/>
Read through the tracklist for <i>Indigo</i> and hear "Acid Test" in the player below.<br/>
<br/>
<em>Indigo</em>:<br/>
<br/>
1. Genesis <br/>
2. No Talk <br/>
3. Acid Test <br/>
4. Midnight <br/>
5. West <br/>
6. Motives <br/>
7. Barcelona <br/>
8. Clarity <br/>
9. I'm a Stone <br/>
10. Maria <br/>
11. Green In Blue <br/>
12. Flood<br/>
<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[Woody Allen on Sexual Abuse Allegations: "I Have Moved So Far Past That"]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/woody-allensm.jpg' alt='Woody Allen on Sexual Abuse Allegations: "I Have Moved So Far Past That"' /><br/><br/>Yesterday, Ronan Farrow brought up the sexual abuse allegations against his father Woody Allen once again with an <a href="http://exclaim.ca/film/article/ronan_farrow_blasts_press_for_dangerous_silence_over_woody_allen_sexual_abuse_allegations">op-ed in <em>The Hollywood Reporter</em></a>. During a press conference at Cannes, journalists confronted Allen about the article.<br/>
<br/>
As <a href="http://www.vulture.com/2016/05/woody-allen-on-ronan-farrow-cannes-rape-joke.html?mid=twitter_vulture"><em>Vulture</em></a> reports, Allen sat at a roundtable with journalists that included <em>Vanity Fair</em>'s Julie Miller and <em>Variety</em>'s Ramin Setoodeh, and they didn't let Allen get through the talk without bringing up Farrow's piece.<br/>
<br/>
Miller asked him if he'd read Farrow's article, and he quickly replied, "I never read anything about me. Any of these interviews I do, anything. I said everything I had to say about that whole issue in the <em>New York Times</em>, I don't know if you read it, some time ago. I have moved so far past that. You know, I never think about it. I work, and that's the end of it for me. I said I was never gonna comment on it again because I could just go on endlessly."<br/>
<br/>
Setoodeh asked Allen if he ever planned to read the article, and he insisted that he wasn't interested. "I never read what you say about me, or the reviews of my films," he said. "I made the decision 35 years ago to never read a review of my movies, never read an interview, never read anything. Because you could easily become obsessed with yourself ... I've been very productive over the years by not thinking about myself, and not obsessing over myself."<br/>
<br/>
In his piece, Farrow criticized the way that Allen's publicist, Leslee Dart, has spun the media's perception of the director. Today, <em><a href="http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/cannes-woody-allen-says-he-893105">The Hollywood Reporter</a> </em>say Dart banned them from attending Allen's roundtable discussion as a punishment for publishing Farrow's piece.<br/>
<br/>
 <img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/ExclaimCaAllArticles/~4/zBgaJ_eeIFg" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[http://exclaim.ca/film/article/woody_allen_on_sexual_abuse_allegations_i_have_moved_so_far_past_that]]></guid>

<title><![CDATA[Assassin's Creed - Trailer]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/assassinssm.jpg' alt='Assassin's Creed - Trailer' /><br/><br/>Hopes are high that this year's <em>Assassin's Creed </em>movie will finally redeem the world of videogame adaptations, especially now that the film's received a promising new trailer.<br/>
<br/>
Starring <span style="line-height: 20.8px;">Michael Fassbender, Marion Cotillard, Jeremy Irons and Brendan Gleeson, the film was directed by Justin Kurzel (</span><em style="line-height: 20.8px;">The Snowtown Murders</em><span style="line-height: 20.8px;">, </span><em style="line-height: 20.8px;">Macbeth</em><span style="line-height: 20.8px;">).<br/>
<br/>
Soundtracked by Kanye West's <em>Yeezus</em> track "I Am a God," this film looks seriously great. Maybe we'll finally have a good videogame movie after all!<br/>
<br/>
Watch the clip for <em>Assassin's Creed</em> below. The film hits theatres on December 21, 2016.</span><br/>

<title><![CDATA[Scour - "Dispatched"]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/scourthum_2.jpg' alt='Scour - "Dispatched"' /><br/><br/>Pushing on from the controversy of his ill-thought out <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/philip_anselmo_sieg_hails_dimebash_crowd_calls_it_inside_joke_of_the_night">nazi salute "joke"</a> at a concert earlier this year, Philip Anselmo has premiered some music from his new metal band, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/scour">Scour</a>. The aggressive supergroup have just unveiled "Dispatched."<br/>
<br/>
The track begins quite menacingly, with black metal-style blast beats and trilled-out guitar damage flying just beneath the grotesque gurgle of frontman Anselmo. The piece is fairly relentless, with even the slow-mo mosh part at the end of the track coming packaged with a viciously stomped-out double kick.<br/>
<br/>
You can hear the brutal cut below, courtesy of <a href="http://decibelmagazine.com/blog/2016/5/11/hear-scour-black-metal-band-featuring-philip-ansemlo-and-pig-destroyer-and-cattle-decapitation-members" target="_blank"><i>Decibel</i></a>.<br/>
<br/>
As <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/phil_anselmo_reveals_new_scour_project_with_members_of_cattle_decapitation_pig_destroyer">previously reported</a>, Scour teams Anselmo with guitarists Derek Engemann (Cattle Decapitation ) and Chase Fraser (Animosity), bassist John Jarvis (Pig Destroyer), and drummer Jesse Schobel (Strong Intention). Their self-titled debut EP will be released July 15 through Anselmo's own <a href="https://www.facebook.com/housecorerecords/" target="_blank">Housecore Records</a>.<br/>
<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[Meshuggah Tease New Album via Trailer]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/meshuggthum.jpg' alt='Meshuggah Tease New Album via Trailer' /><br/><br/>While <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/meshuggah">Meshuggah</a> have spent the past few years celebrating their back catalogue with some <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/meshuggah_celebrate_25th_anniversary_with_reissue_campaign">reissues</a>, it's apparently time for the groove-heavy djent crew to blast us with some new tracks. The band are now teasing that a full-length release, their first in four years, will touch down sometime this fall.<br/>
<br/>
Not much has been coughed up in the way of details just yet, but the Swedish metal force announced the impending arrival of their next LP today (May 12). It's currently being teased with a blip of new music that specializes in hard chugged riffs and elastic drum fills.<br/>
<br/>
As you'll see down below, the teaser vid also shows off a few pictures of the band working in the studio before announcing that the record is due sometime this fall. A European tour with High on Fire has also been announced, with the details of the tour route available over <a href="https://www.facebook.com/meshuggah/photos/a.10150681358846170.423006.7791476169/10154199772926170/?type=3&amp;theater" target="_blank">here</a>.<br/>
<br/>
Meshuggah haven't released an album of original material since 2012's <a href="http://exclaim.ca/Reviews/Metal/meshuggah-koloss"><i>Koloss</i></a>. They did, however, kick off a reissue campaign for their albums in 2013 and delivered an <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/meshuggah_delivering_expanded_edition_of_i">expanded edition</a> of their <i>I</i> EP in 2014.<br/>
<br/>
The band also celebrated <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/meshuggah_announce_25th_anniversary_tour">25 years of punishment</a> with a 2015 tour that brought them to Toronto, as well as Heavy Montreal event. You'll find Exclaim!'s review of the latter over <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/meshuggah-parc_jean-drapeau_montreal_qc_august_7">here</a>.<br/>
<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Chance the Rapper - "No Problem" (ft. 2 Chainz & Lil Wayne)]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/chance3thum.jpg' alt='Chance the Rapper - "No Problem" (ft. 2 Chainz & Lil Wayne)' /><br/><br/>Chicago MC <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/chance_rapper">Chance the Rapper's</a> latest mixtape, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/chance_the_rapper_releasing_chance_3_next_week_premieres_blessings_on_fallon"><em>Chance 3</em></a>, is set to arrive tonight, and he has shared a new track ahead of the tape's release.<br/>
<br/>
Premiered through Zane Lowe's Beats 1 Radio show this afternoon, "No Problem" sees the young talent join up with southern rap stars 2 Chainz and Lil Wayne over a joyous beat highlighted by a choir sample and knocking drums. <br/>
<br/>
Though we haven't heard the entire tape yet, the first taste of it is definitely <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/chance_the_rapper_signs_petition_to_make_free_music_grammy_eligible">Grammy-worthy</a>. Take a listen to the three team up on "No Problem" below.<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[Good Charlotte - "Life Changes"]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/goodcharlottesm.jpg' alt='Good Charlotte - "Life Changes"' /><br/><br/>It's time once again to engage in some subtle anarchy — perhaps you should lean back in your chair a little too far, eat candy for lunch or call your parents and tell them to "eff off." After all, lite punk maestros <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/Good_Charlotte" style="line-height: 20.8px;">Good Charlotte</a> are back with another anthem.<br/>
<br/>
Their latest three-minute banger is called "Life Changes," which we can only assume is a song about puberty written by men in their late 30s.<br/>
<br/>
Either way, it's a fairly delightful little pop-punk number built on a single jangly guitar chord. Eventually, the octave leads kick in, the song speeds up and we all start circle pitting at home while we think about how stupid it is that we have to clean our bedrooms.<br/>
<br/>
Thanks to its fist-pumping, half-tempo chorus, "Life Changes" is a genuinely great punk song. It's got us even more hyped on GC's upcoming <em>Youth Authority </em>record. Soon it will be safe for the punks to proudly walk the mall once again.<br/>
<br/>
Listen to "Life Changes" below.<br/>
<br/>
<em>Youth Authority</em> arrives July 15 via <a href="http://mddn.co/" target="_blank">MDDN</a>, and you can pre-order it <a href="http://goodcharlotte.shop.musictoday.com/dept/new-album-pre-order?cp=81288_81289" target="_blank">here</a>.<br/>

<title><![CDATA[2 Chainz - "100 Joints" (video)]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/2Chainz100JointsThumb.jpg' alt='2 Chainz - "100 Joints" (video)' /><br/><br/>Some may find it necessary to smoke 100 joints a day to forget that Donald Trump becoming president of the United States is something that could actually happen. Consequently, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/2_chainz">2 Chainz</a>'s new video for "100 Joints" refutes Trump's racist lines of thinking altogether.<br/>
<br/>
Shot entirely in black and white, the video follows a day in the life of a Muslim family, interspersed with footage of 2 Chainz delivering his verses. Opening with some quotes from Trump and his campaign website, the video closes with the much more appropriate and accepting message that "Muslim Americans live their day to day life just like all other Americans. They are not all terrorists that hate America."<br/>
<br/>
The track comes from <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/2_chainz_lil_wayne">2 Chainz and Lil Wayne's</a> collaborative record <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/2_chainz_and_lil_wayne-collegrove_album_stream"><i>Collegrove</i></a>. Watch the video for "100 Joints" in the player below.<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[Azealia Banks' Twitter Account Suspended Following Racist and Homophobic Tweet Spree Against Zayn]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/azebigbeatthum.jpg' alt='Azealia Banks' Twitter Account Suspended Following Racist and Homophobic Tweet Spree Against Zayn' /><br/><br/>After being <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/azealia_banks_kicked_off_festival_bill_for_racist_and_homophobic_tweets_to_zayn">kicked off</a> London's <a href="https://twitter.com/bornandbredLDN/status/730359513979719680">Born & Bred Festival</a> earlier this week for directing a series of racist and homophobic tweets towards pop singer Zayn, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/azealia_banks">Azealia Banks</a> has now been met with some disciplinary action online. Her <a href="http://twitter.com/account/suspended" target="_blank">Twitter account</a> has now been suspended.<br/>
<br/>
As of press time, as <a href="http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2016/05/azealia-banks-twitter-account-suspended/" target="_blank"><i>XXL</i></a> points out, Banks' often controversy-stirring Twitter profile is down, with the company confirming that the account <a href="https://twitter.com/account/suspended" target="_blank">has been suspended</a>. Going by the rules and regulations laid out by Twitter, this looks to have been done because of Banks' "abusive tweets."<br/>
<br/>
"We may suspend an account if it has been reported to us as violating our Rules surrounding abuse," it says in the <a href="https://support.twitter.com/articles/15790" target="_blank">company guidelines</a>. "When an account engages in abusive behavior, like sending threats to others or impersonating other accounts, we may suspend it temporarily or, in some cases, permanently. "<br/>
<br/>
As previously reported, Banks had taken aim at Zayn for reportedly biting her <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/azealia_banks-chasing_time_video">"Chasing Time"</a> video with his <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/zayn-like_i_would_video">"Like I Would."</a> When the pop performer seemingly brushed off Banks' challenge, she let loose a number of racial and homophobic slurs over a series of tweets, which were grounded on the belief that British Pakistani Zayn was formerly the "token" member of the otherwise white One Direction.<br/>
<br/>
Following an uproar from 1D fans, the rest of the online community and the Born & Bred Festival, Banks had apologized for upsetting people, though not for her comments.<br/>
<br/>
"Big apologies to anyone who was offended by any of the things I said," she had said in a now deleted tweet. "Not sorry I said it. But sorry for the way I made people feel."<br/>
<br/>
Being removed from Twitter, whether temporarily or permanently, is just the latest controversy Banks has been involved in. In recent times, she's <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/azealia_banks_booked_for_assault_after_biting_security_guard_in_boob">bitten a security guard</a>, beefed with <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/azealia_banks-harlem_shake">Baauer</a>, and threw her political support behind <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/azealia_banks_endorses_donald_trump_in_twitter_spree">Donald Trump</a>.<br/>
<br/>
<strong>UPDATE (5/12, 4:15 p.m.): Since Banks can't vent on Twitter anymore, she's taken to her <a href="https://www.instagram.com/azealiabanks/" target="_blank">Instagram</a> to blow off her steam. You can see some of her recent posts below, where she promises to reveal an essay called "Whiteness Is a Mental Illness."</strong><br/><br>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[ILOVEMAKONNEN - "Sound Like Who?"]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/makonnensoundsm.jpg' alt='ILOVEMAKONNEN - "Sound Like Who?"' /><br/><br/>Sing-rapper <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/ilovemakonnen">ILOVEMAKONNEN</a> continues to croon out some classic bangers, and his latest track "Sound Like Who?" is no different.<br/>
<br/>
Produced by Danny Wolf, the song's built on a slow, brooding synth sound. That said, despite its dour tone, it's another revved up anthem from the seemingly untouchable performer.<br/>
<br/>
Listen to ILOVEMAKONNEN's latest hit below. <br/>

<title><![CDATA[Drake Catered the 'SNL' Table Read with Food from Celebrity Chef Bobby Flay]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/drakebobbyflaysm.jpg' alt='Drake Catered the 'SNL' Table Read with Food from Celebrity Chef Bobby Flay' /><br/><br/>This weekend, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/drake">Drake</a> will bring his <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/drake-views"><em>VIEWS</em></a> from the 6 to the Big Apple with a double-duty hosting and performing gig on <em>Saturday Night Live</em>. The week leading up to <em>SNL</em> is full of legendary rituals, including the Wednesday night table read. Rather than stick to the usual craft services, however, Drizzy made things bougie last night.<br/>
<br/>
The Toronto rapper couldn't grab food from his beloved Frings, but he did the next best thing by catering the table read with munchies from <a href="http://www.foodnetwork.com/chefs/bobby-flay.html">The Food Network</a>'s beloved <a href="http://bobbyflay.com/">Bobby Flay</a>.<br/>
<br/>
While it's considered gauche to post food pics on Instagram in 2016, cast member Cecily Strong was certainly within her rights to <a href="http://www.instagram.com/p/BFSYg8nvbqQ/">share</a> this extremely fancy meal. <br/>
<br/>
"DRAKE GAVE US A BOBBY FLAY DINNER AND THIS IS THE BEST DAY OF ALL OF OUR LIVES," she exclaimed. Lest you think she wasn't serious, she added a wonderful "FBDBFBSNDNVXJSK."<br/>
<br/>
Peep the food pic below and catch Drake on <em>SNL</em> on Saturday (May 14).<br/>

<title><![CDATA[The Prettys - "Friendship" (video)]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/prettys-sm.jpg' alt='The Prettys - "Friendship" (video)' /><br/><br/>Vancouver rockers <a href="https://theprettys.bandcamp.com/releases" target="_blank">the Prettys</a> are gearing up to release their sophomore full-length <em>Soirée </em>this summer, but before the new LP arrives, Exclaim! is giving you a first look at the band's brand new video for "Friendship."<br/>
 <br/>
The clip was directed by the band's sax man Matty Reed, and it was captured to film in a single shot. Naturally, the band opted to use the third to last take since it featured "the most people and the most confetti."<br/>
 <br/>
Despite its bright, upbeat sound, the track itself attempts to convey the loneliness that can set in after "being really shitty to a close friend and losing their friendship," but wanting to let them know that you're still there for them. The video hones in on that feeling, focusing on bass player Pierce Kingan as he strolls down the street alone — encountering flash mobs of people that ultimately only exist in his head.<br/>
 <br/>
Join him on his solitary stroll through the city by watching the video for "Friendship" below. The single is currently available on <a href="https://theprettys.bandcamp.com/releases" target="_blank">Bandcamp</a>.<br/>
 <br/>

<title><![CDATA[Skydiggers - "Set You Free This Time" (Byrds cover) (video)]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/skydiggvidthum.jpg' alt='Skydiggers - "Set You Free This Time" (Byrds cover) (video)' /><br/><br/>As previously reported, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/skydiggers">Skydiggers</a> are just about to release their Gene Clark-tributing <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/skydiggers-here_without_you">Here Without You</a>.</em> Before the record can send you, well, "Eight Miles High," the Toronto roots troupe are celebrating bipedal motion in a music video for their take on "Set You Free This Time."<br/>
<br/>
Skydiggers' interpretation of the Byrds number is intimate and tender, with light strums supporting Andy Maize's half-hushed vocals. Visually, we're privy to some filter-distorted, birds-eye view shots of an in-motion bicycle before the camera angle observes various figures fleeing the scene.<br/>
<br/>
Gentle and ruminative, the video can be found below.<br/>
<br/>
While <i>Here Without You</i> goes on sale tomorrow (May 13) through <a href="http://latentrecordings.com/" target="_blank">Latent Records</a>, Exclaim! is currently streaming the album in full over <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/skydiggers-here_without_you_album_stream">here</a>.<br/>
<br/>

<title><![CDATA[NXNE Adds Schoolboy Q, Land of Talk, Born Ruffians]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/nxne-sm.jpg' alt='NXNE Adds Schoolboy Q, Land of Talk, Born Ruffians' /><br/><br/>Despite a <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/nxne_president_michael_hollett_discusses_big_changes_at_this_years_fest">massive revamp</a>, Toronto's long-running <a href="http://nxne.com/" target="_blank">North by Northeast</a> will soon return. Set to run from June 13 to 19 via a <a href='http://exclaim.ca/music/article/nxne_2016_gets_kamasi_washington_the_joy_formidable_cold_specks_for_club_shows'>series of club shows</a> and a <a href='http://exclaim.ca/music/article/nxne_announces_port_lands_lineup_with_father_john_misty_ghostface_killah_dan_mangan'>big bash at the Port Lands</a>, we've already received a few lineup announcements, and today we've just got another. <br><br>
Adding to the NXNE Port Lands festivities on June 17 will be Schoolboy Q, Tasha the Amazon and Tiken Jah Fakoly. These artists join a bill that already includes Ghostface Killah, Shamir, Daniel Caesar and Mick Jenkins.
<br><br>
Then on June 18, Land of Talk, Born Ruffians and HIGHS will join previously announced artists such as Father John Misty, Mother Mother, Dan Mangan, the Zolas and the Devin Cuddy Band. <br><br>
As for NXNE Club Land, there have also been a few additions, such as a Halifax Pop Explosion showcase featuring Vogue Dots, Walrus, Mardeen, Partner, and Glory Glory. Also, M for Montreal will hold a showcase that includes Kandle & The Krooks, Michael Rault, Alex Calder, and Homeshake. A few more artists who have been added to the club series are Kiki Rowe, Towers, Billy Moon, the OBGM's and Jon Bryant.
<br><br>
These all join previously announced club acts (in alphabetical order) Adam Baldwin, A-WA, Bad Sports, the Beatdown, Bertrand Belin, Big Eyes, Big Ups, Bionic, Birds of Bellwoods, Brains, Bry Webb & Providers, Cold Specks, DIANA, Danny Rebel & the KGB, Dig It Up!, DJ Shub, Duotang, Eagulls, Escondido, Eternal Sleep, Full of Hell, God's Hate, the Hunna, the IMF's, Jesse Mac Cormack, the Joy Formidable, Kamasi Washington, Kevin Morby, King Khan and The Shrines, K-Man & the 45s, Mariam, Mikey Erg, the Motorleague, Moving Units, MSTRKRFT, Nails, NQ Arbuckle, Pere Ubu, Prozzak, Radioactivity, SATE, Screaming Females, Shawnee, Shred Kelly, the So So Glos, Stonefield, Sun K, USA Out of Vietnam, the Worriers, and the Yardlets.<br><br>
Find full festival information at the <a href="http://nxne.com/" target="_blank">official website</a> and pick up tickets for both portions of NXNE <a href='http://nxne.com/tickets/' target='_blank'>here</a>.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/ExclaimCaAllArticles/~4/aSDglDKfLcU" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/ExclaimCaAllArticles/~3/aSDglDKfLcU/nxne_adds_schoolboy_q_land_of_talk_born_ruffians</link>

<title><![CDATA[Iggy Pop - "Sunday" (video)]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/iggysundaythum.jpg' alt='Iggy Pop - "Sunday" (video)' /><br/><br/>While filled with a number of cool cuts, "Sunday" has become one of the standout tracks of <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/iggy_pop">Iggy Pop</a>'s recent <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/iggy_pop_joins_forces_with_josh_homme_for_collaborative_album">Post Pop Depression</a></em>. After taking the song out to <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/iggy_pop_performs_sunday_on_jimmy_kimmel_live"><i>Jimmy Kimmel Live</i></a> the other week, the punk rock icon has now unveiled his lazy weekend routine in a new music video for the single.<br/>
<br/>
Directed by Andreas Neumann, the clip first finds Pop prepping a cup of coffee at his tropical abode, only to walk outside and pull off some limber, tongue-wagging Tai Chi moves. The video also bounces over to the Joshua Tree, where album co-conspirator Josh Homme (Queens of the Stone Age) is splitting wood. Also, the musician seems to have a banana in his pocket. Really.<br/>
<br/>
You can watch the video for Iggy Pop's especially funkified <i>Post Pop Depression</i> single down below.<br/>

<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/greystvsm.jpg' alt='Greys - "I'd Hate To Be An Actor" / "No Star" / "Blown Out" on Exclaim! TV' /><br/><br/>Toronto post-punk group <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/greys" target="_blank">Greys</a> have been making waves in the local music scene for a few years now, but on the heels of their new album, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/greys-outer_heaven" target="_blank"><i>Outer Heaven</i></a>, the band stopped by Exclaim! headquarters to perform three songs.<br/>
<br/>
"Blown Out" and "No Star" are both tracks from the new release, but while "I'd Hate To Be An Actor" is a cut from 2015's <i>Repulsion</i>, all three clips show the band's high-energy performance style, filled with major guitar shredding and explosive drum cymbal crashes.<br/>
<br/>
You can catch the T.O. noisemakers at their hometown LP release show this <a href="https://www.facebook.com/events/1118068964891909/" target="_blank">Friday, May 13 at the Garrison</a>. Below, find a little taste of what to expect.<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Head Wound City - 'A New Wave of Violence' (album stream)]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/HWCviolencethum.jpg' alt='Head Wound City - 'A New Wave of Violence' (album stream)' /><br/><br/>Reassembled radical friends <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/head_wound_city">Head Wound City</a> officially make their grand and furious return tomorrow (May 13) with the release of their <i><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/head_wound_city-a_new_wave_of_violence">A New Wave of Violence</a></i>, but the faithful are being blessed with a freaky treat ahead of time. Following a <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/head_wound_city-scraper_video">video premiere</a> and their <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/head_wound_city-just_one_fix_ministry_cover">Ministry cover</a>, the post-hardcore supergroup are streaming the record in full right now.<br/>
<br/>
Already, we'd heard the smashed-light-bulb gutter glam of "Scraper," a song that came affixed with a shotgun-firing music video. Other high artillery tracks include the manically whomped pseudo-anthem, "Head Wound City, USA," on which lead vocalist Jordan Blilie describes and decries the "city of the wretched and plain," or the speedy junk punk terror of "Closed Casket."<br/>
<br/>
Produced by Ross Robinson (At the Drive-In, Slipknot, Blood Brothers), the record can be streamed in full below. <i>A New Wave of Violence</i> hits retailers tomorrow through <a href="http://www.vicerecords.com/" target="_blank">Vice</a>.<br/>
<br/>
As previously reported, Head Wound City head out on the road with UK act Savages this month, and will hit up a handful of Canadian cities along the way. You'll find the tour details over <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/head_wound_city_add_north_american_dates_with_savages">here</a>.<br/>
<br/>
Exclaim!'s full review of <i>A New Wave of Violence</i> can be found <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/head_wound_city-a_new_wave_of_violence">here</a>.<br/>
<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[Chelsea Wolfe, Lab Coast and Royce 5'9" Lead This Week's Can't Miss Concerts]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/WolfeMcInnissm.jpg' alt='Chelsea Wolfe, Lab Coast and Royce 5'9" Lead This Week's Can't Miss Concerts' /><br/><br/>This week's Can't Miss Concerts, from May 12 to 18, covers the relentless Viking Metal of Amon Amarth, the vintage soul sounds of Tanika Charles and everything in between. Read on to see our picks for the best shows this week and check out our complete <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts">Concert Listings</a> to see what we've missed.<br/>
 <br/>
 <br/>
<strong>Amon Amarth  </strong><br/>
 <br/>
Fresh off a run of shows through Quebec and Ontario in support of their first concept album, <em>Jomsviking</em>, Amon Amarth are bringing their bone-crushing brand of Viking Metal to the Prairies. Concertgoers can expect tales of swords, sorcery and vengeance; Valhalla awaits at the dates listed below. <br/>
 <br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/amon_amarth-winnipeg-2016-05-12">05/12/2016 Winnipeg, MB – The Garrick Center</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/amon_amarth-saskatoon-2016-05-13">05/13/2016 Saskatoon, SK – O'Brian's Event Centre</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/amon_amarth-calgary-2016-05-14">05/14/2016 Calgary, AB – MacEwan Hall</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/amon_amarth-vancouver-2016-05-16">05/16/2016 Vancouver, BC – Commodore Ballroom</a><br/>
 <br/>
<strong>Black Mountain</strong><br/>
 <br/>
Boasting a blend of Sabbathian guitar hooks and airy psychedelia, Black Mountain made a name for themselves by producing some of the best stoner rock of the 2000s. Now they're back on the road in support of <em>IV</em>, their first album in six years. Check them out at one of the venues below.<br/>
 <br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/black_mountain-winnipeg-2016-05-15">05/15/2016 Winnipeg, MB – The Pyramid</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/black_mountain-saskatoon-2016-05-17">05/17/2016 Saskatoon, SK – Amigos Cantina</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/black_mountain-edmonton-2016-05-18">05/18/2016 Edmonton, AB – The Starlite Room</a><br/>
 <br/>
<strong>Cate Le Bon</strong><br/>
 <br/>
After putting out one of the most sublimely weird records of the year so far in <em>Crab Day</em>, Welsh singer-songwriter Cate Le Bon is bringing her off-kilter guitar pop stylings to Canadian audiences this summer. Le Bon promises "a coalition of inescapable feelings and fabricated nonsense, each propping the other up" — not a bad way to spend a Thursday night.<br/>
 <br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/cate_le_bon-vancouver-2016-05-12">05/12/2016 Vancouver, BC – The Biltmore Cabaret</a><br/>
 <br/>
<strong>Tanika Charles</strong><br/>
 <br/>
Fans looking for a burst of classic soul, look no further than Tanika Charles. The Edmonton-born, Toronto-based songstress emulates the greats with a modern twist on her new LP, <em>Soul Run</em>. For those who never made it to the Apollo in the '60s and '70s, one of these dates might be the next best thing.<br/>
 <br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/tanika_charles-montreal-2016-05-12">05/12/2016 Montreal, QC – Le Belmont</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/tanika_charles-ottawa-2016-05-14">05/14/2016 Ottawa, ON – Ritual</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/tanika_charles-kingston-2016-05-15">05/15/2016 Kingston, ON – The Mansion</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/tanika_charles-thunder_bay-2016-05-17">05/17/2016 Thunder Bay, ON – The Foundry</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/tanika_charles-winnipeg-2016-05-18">05/18/2016 Winnipeg, MB – The Good Will</a><br/>
 <br/>
<strong>Greys</strong><br/>
 <br/>
After a series of tune-up shows in April, Toronto post-punks Greys are pulling out all the stops back home in celebration of the release of <em>Outer Heaven</em>, their blistering sophomore LP. If you've been aching to break out the Doc Martens and mosh, this show is for you.<br/>
 <br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/greys-outer_heaven_album_release_party-toronto-2016-05-13">05/13/2016 Toronto, ON – The Garrison</a><br/>
 <br/>
<strong>Lab Coast</strong><br/>
 <br/>
Calgary indie rockers Lab Coast have been around since 2008, but their new album, <em>Remember the Moon</em>, proves that the band's trademark laid-back sound is still unmatched as a form of stress release. It's perfect auditory therapy for those still thawing from the winter in Winnipeg this week.<br/>
 <br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/lab_coast-winnipeg-2016-05-14">05/14/2016 Winnipeg, MB – The Handsome Daughter</a><br/>
 <br/>
<strong>Lil Uzi Vert</strong><br/>
 <br/>
After being forced to postpone his show in March due to health issues, Lil Uzi Vert returns to Vancouver this Saturday (May 14) for an evening of pulsating hip-hop bangers from his new full-length,<em> <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/lil_uzi_vert-lil_uzi_vert_vs_the_world_mixtape_stream">Lil Uzi Vert vs. the World</a></em>. Fans of space-age trap beats and Travis Scott-style Auto-Tune acrobatics should look no further.<br/>
 <br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/lil_uzi_vert_x_playboi_carti-vancouver-2016-05-14">05/14/2016 Vancouver, BC – Alexander</a><br/>
 <br/>
<strong>The Pack A.D. </strong><br/>
 <br/>
Vancouver garage rock royalty the Pack A.D. are back out on the road in support of an as-yet unnamed upcoming LP. The duo of drummer Maya Miller and singer/guitarist Becky Black have a long history of doing a lot with a little, electrifying audiences with their booming drums and relentless riffage for over a decade now. See what the fuss is about at one of their hometown dates below.<br/>
 <br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/pack_d-vancouver-2016-05-12">05/12/2016 Vancouver, BC – The Cobalt</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/pack_d-vancouver-2016-05-13">05/13/2016 Vancouver, BC – The Cobalt</a><br/>
 <br/>
<strong>Royce 5'9"</strong><br/>
 <br/>
After a five-year hiatus, Royce 5'9" has come out with guns blazing in 2016. He's already put out one album this year (<em>Layers</em>) and plans to release another, titled <em>Book of Ryan</em>. At this rate, this may be your last chance to see the Detroit MC before his setlist is filled entirely with new material.<br/>
 <br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/royce_da_59-ottawa-2016-05-12">05/12/2016 Ottawa, ON – Ritual</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/royce_da_59-kingston-2016-05-13">05/13/2016 Kingston, ON – Overtime Sports Bar and Grill</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/royce_da_59-montreal-2016-05-14">05/14/2016 Montreal, QC – Le Belmont</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/royce_da_59-waterloo-2016-05-15">05/15/2016 Waterloo, ON – Starlight Social Club</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/royce_da_59-london-2016-05-16">05/16/2016 London, ON – Grinning Gator Bar and Grill</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/royce_da_59-toronto-2016-05-17">05/17/2016 Toronto, ON – Mod Club Theatre</a><br/>
 <br/>
<strong>Chelsea Wolfe</strong><br/>
 <br/>
On her last album, 2015's <em>Abyss</em>, Los Angeles singer-songwriter blended the sublime with the sinister, to spellbinding effect. Fusing gothic folk with elements of metal, noise rock and drone, Wolfe's live sets have everything but optimism. Indulge your inner darkness at one of the dates below.<br/>
 <br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/chelsea_wolfe-montreal-2016-05-16">05/16/2016 Montreal, QC – Fairmount Theatre</a><br/>
<a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts/chelsea_wolfe-toronto-2016-05-17">05/17/2016 Toronto, ON – The Opera House</a><br/>
 <br/>
 <br/>
<em>Head to Exclaim!'s full </em><em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/concerts"><strong>Concert Listings</strong></a> for many more concerts and events.</em><br/>

<title><![CDATA[The Jezabels - "My Love Is My Disease" (video)]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/jezabels-sm.jpg' alt='The Jezabels - "My Love Is My Disease" (video)' /><br/><br/>Australian outfit <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/jezabels">the Jezabels</a> showed off their synth-pop chops on <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/the_jezabels-synthia">Synthia</a> </em>earlier this year, and while the band is currently taking a break from touring while keyboardist Heather Shannon <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/the_jezabels_cancel_tour_while_keyboardist_heather_shannon_battles_cancer">battles cancer</a>, they've still got some new content to share with fans.<br/>
 <br/>
They've just shared a new video for album cut "My Love Is My Disease," which was directed by Jonathon Lim and finds a Tokyo commuter trying to escape his own invisible inner demons.<br/>
 <br/>
"It's about de-stigmatising illness I think, particularly mental illness, but physical too," frontwoman Hayley Mary explained in a press release. "I guess it can be such a burden for people when they feel alone in it. Maybe the hyperbolic tone of the song is a little bit of an attempt to be a bit self satirical and bring a lightness to the topic of illness, because sometimes owning your ailments, and laughing a little at yourself and the incredible tragicomedy of life helps you get through it I suppose."<br/>
 <br/>
See that sentiment come to life in the video for "My Love Is My Disease" below. <em>Synthia </em>is out now on <a href="http://dinealonerecords.com/" target="_blank">Dine Alone</a>.<br/>
 <br/>

<title><![CDATA[Prince Ness - "Broadway Rain" (video)]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/princenesssm.jpg' alt='Prince Ness - "Broadway Rain" (video)' /><br/><br/>Rising Toronto artist <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/Prince_Ness">Prince Ness</a> makes gloriously strange indie pop, and he's just shared an equally alluring video for his new song "Broadway Rain" which Exclaim! is happy to premiere today (May 12).<br/>
<br/>
The song pairs lovingly picked guitar with blissed-out synths, a drum machine and Prince Ness's detached vocals. The song arrives via an equally out-there video complete with mannequins, trippy visuals and an up-skirt shot.<br/>
<br/>
Watch the video for "Broadway Rain" below. The song appears alongside "Nice Life" on a new cassingle from Ben Cook's <a href="http://www.badactorsinc.com/">Bad Actors, Inc</a>.<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Glenn Danzig Reunites with the Misfits for First Shows in over 30 Years]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/MisfitsAdmatRevthum.jpg' alt='Glenn Danzig Reunites with the Misfits for First Shows in over 30 Years' /><br/><br/>Slick down your devilocks and polish your Crimson Ghost tattoos, you bunch of fiends, because the impossible has just happened: <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/danzig">Glenn Danzig</a> has announced he's reuniting with <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/misfits">the Misfits</a> for a pair of gigs. Lodi, NJ's greatest horror punk band will <i>Walk Among Us</i> again as part of this year's Riot Fest.<br/>
<br/>
A press release confirms that Danzig has patched things up with bassist Jerry Only to headline this September's Riot Fest Rodeo in Denver and the Riot Fest & Carnival in Chicago. Billed as "the Original Misfits," they'll be joined by longtime guitarist Doyle Wolfgang von Frankenstein. It's as yet unclear who will be sitting behind the drums.<br/>
<br/>
The performances are notable in that this will be the first time Danzig and Only have been onstage together since 1983. That year, the group would break up, with Danzig going on to form Samhain and later his blues- and metal-minded Danzig project. Only revived the Misfits in 1995 and has maintained a revolving lineup since then.<br/>
<br/>
Despite branching off into a different direction, Danzig has still stayed attached to the Misfits brand. His series of <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/danzig_adds_25th_anniversary_show_in_vancouver">"Legacy"</a> concerts had him and Doyle bashing out Misfits classics for ghouls worldwide.<br/>
<br/>
The reunion is also notable since the relationship between Danzig and fellow Misfits founder Only has been nothing short of acrimonious over the years. Even as recently as 2014, the then former bandmates were <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/judge_dismisses_glenn_danzigs_misfits_lawsuit">battling it out in court</a> over merchandising royalties. A judge had thrown out Danzig's claims that Only had violated the terms of a contract the two had signed in 1994, for which the singer was seeking $75,000 in damages.<br/>
<br/>
For the time being, it appears as if these may be the only two shows for "the Original Misfits," but keep your bony fingers crossed that the group go out and kill it for another few nights.<br/>
<br/>
The Denver Riot Fest runs September 2 to 4, while the Chicago edition takes place September 16 to 18. As previously reported, the fest is unfortunately <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/riot_fest_isnt_coming_to_toronto_in_2016">skipping over</a> Toronto this year.<br/>
<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Amai Kuda - "We Can Do It! (Dirty Money)" (ft. Y, M1 and Kinnie Starr) (video)]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/amaikuda-sm.jpg' alt='Amai Kuda - "We Can Do It! (Dirty Money)" (ft. Y, M1 and Kinnie Starr) (video)' /><br/><br/><a href="https://www.facebook.com/Amai-Kuda-Y-Josephine-158653904159484">Amai Kuda</a> has teamed up with Josephine Y, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/kinnie_starr">Kinnie Starr</a> and <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/dead_prez">Dead Prez</a>'s M1 for a politically charged new track called "We Can Do It! (Dirty Money)" — and Exclaim! is giving you the first look at the brand new accompanying video.<br/>
 <br/>
The group of artists first got together at the Paris Climate Summit last year, and since collaborated to create a song that stands in solidarity with Decolonize NOW! — a coalition dedicated to supporting the causes of black and indigenous communities and "the protection of the earth and her peoples."<br/>
 <br/>
The coalition includes groups like Black Lives Matter, No More Silence, Mining Injustice Solidarity Network, OPIRG York, OPIRG UofT, Rising Tide Toronto, Flood the System, the ALBA Network and Diaspora Travels. The new song is specifically being issued in support of DNOW!'s Divest to Decolonize: Invest in Justice campaign, which "targets banks for their central role in the world's worst colonial injustices," citing mining and fossil fuel industries, arms trade, big pharma, destructive agribusiness, the production of nuclear weapons, and exploitative labour practices as the worst offenders.<br/>
 <br/>
Kuda calls the new song a call to action and a call to revolution, insisting: "We CAN do it on our own! We will create viable, sustainable alternatives to capitalist economies. We must Decolonize Now or watch the earth and our peoples be destroyed!"<br/>
 <br/>
You can see and hear that message come to life by watching the powerful new video for "We Can Do It! (Dirty Money)" in the player below.<br/>

<title><![CDATA[​Watch Taylor Swift Channel the Darkness for Latest Apple Music Ad]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/swift-sm.jpg' alt='​Watch Taylor Swift Channel the Darkness for Latest Apple Music Ad' /><br/><br/>In <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/taylor_swift">Taylor Swift</a>'s quest to <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/taylor_swift_to_stream_1989_on_apple_music">champion Apple Music</a>, no song is safe. The pop star has already starred in spots for the streaming service that see her jamming to <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/watch_taylor_swift_faceplant_to_jumpman_in_new_apple_music_commercial">Drake and Future's "Jumpman"</a> and <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/taylor_swift_rocks_out_to_jimmy_eat_world_in_latest_apple_music_ad">Jimmy Eat World's "The Middle,"</a> and now, she's taken on the guiltiest of guilty pleasures.<br/>
 <br/>
The latest commercial finds Swift selecting some music to soundtrack her "quiet night at home." But even she isn't immune to the glam rock glory of the Darkness, and as soon as the opening riffs to "I Believe in a Thing Called Love" run through her speakers, she's bouncing off the walls of her house like a woman possessed.<br/>
 <br/>
Watch her channel her inner Justin Hawkins, as she headbangs her way to the top of the coffee table and gyrates all over her sofa. Just hit play below.<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Muse - "Aftermath" (video)]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/muse-sm_2.jpg' alt='Muse - "Aftermath" (video)' /><br/><br/><a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/muse">Muse</a> are currently touring in support of last year's LP <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/muse_announce_drones_album">Drones</a></em>, and seem to be <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/muse_drone_crashes_during_london_show">struggling to control the flying objects</a> from which the album takes its name at their live shows. Nevertheless, the band are continuing the promotional push behind the record by releasing a new video for "Aftermath."<br/>
 <br/>
The video finds the band collaborating once again with Japanese director Tekken, who previously animated clips for on "Follow Me" and "Exogenesis: Symphony Part 3 (Redemption)." The latest one tells the sad story of a lonely soldier, who moves through an illustrated world, encountering emotional flashbacks of the family life he used to know as he tries to build a new one in the aftermath of war.<br/>
 <br/>
Take in the new clip from the drone-free safety of your own home by hitting play below.<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[Jessy Lanza Embraces the Spotlight with 'Oh No']]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/Jessy_Lanza_-_Hollie_Pocsai_thumb.jpg' alt='Jessy Lanza Embraces the Spotlight with 'Oh No'' /><br/><br/>"I think if you're prone to anxiety, music can end up being one of the worst career choices you can make, given that it's not easy to make money, it's unpredictable and there are a lot of questions," <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/jessy_lanza" target="_blank">Jessy Lanza</a> tells Exclaim! "A lot of things fall through, so you have to be prepared to be easy about most things."<br/>
 <br/>
The Hamilton, ON-based singer-producer wasn't prepared for the breakthrough that occurred when she released her debut, <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/jessy_lanza-pull_my_hair_back" target="_blank">Pull My Hair Back</a></em>, in 2013. She was an unknown artist at the time who'd struck up a partnership with <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/junior_boys" target="_blank">Junior Boys</a>' Jeremy Greenspan and found a deal with the highly influential UK label <a href="http://www.hyperdub.net/" target="_blank">Hyperdub</a>, but she still had very low expectations. When the album began to get noticed by the music press — eventually resulting in a Polaris Music Prize shortlist nomination and an opening slot on Caribou's European tour — things changed.<br/>
 <br/>
"Since I was a kid I've been pretty nervous. I was one of those kids that cried at everything and anything. I've always felt that having music has really helped with being caught up in your own self-obsessed neuroses. Music has always been a great escape for me. When I released the first album I didn't really have any expectations. But when it actually went well and people liked it and I got to tour, it was weird because music became my career and that was kind of stressful."<br/>
 <br/>
This "constant nervousness" had a profound effect on the recording process of <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/jessy_lanza_returns_with_oh_no_premieres_new_video" target="_blank">Oh No</a></em>, her second full-length, out Friday (May 13) via <a href="http://www.hyperdub.net/" target="_blank">Hyperdub</a>. While Lanza has felt the pressure, she has a newfound confidence both as a vocalist and producer that provides added nuances to <em>Oh No</em>. The stripped-back, reticent production with which she struck a chord on <em>Pull My Hair Back</em> has been bolstered and reshaped on <em>Oh No</em>, resulting in an emphatic collection of contemporary R&B-pop.<br/>
 <br/>
"I definitely felt more confident [on this one]," she admits. "I think Jeremy and I both had a better understanding of what we were going to do. I felt more focused on this idea that we were going to make a poppier album. <em>Pull My Hair Back </em>came together over a period of time where there was a lot of trial and error. Jeremy and I were learning how to work best with one another. We did so many tracks before releasing that album and nobody gave a shit, which was fine. But it took a long time for us to find a sound for <em>Pull My Hair Back</em>, and this album just came together a bit easier."<br/>
 <br/>
<em>Oh No </em>was recorded during the same time frame as the recent Junior Boys album, <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/junior_boys-big_black_coat" target="_blank">Big Black Coat</a></em>. Both Lanza and Greenspan have their own studios in downtown Hamilton just a few blocks apart, which meant there was a constant back-and-forth for both of them. But knowing not to mess with a good thing, they kept the whole process similar to that of making <em>Pull My Hair Back</em>.<br/>
 <br/>
"We definitely worked on tracks much in the same way as the first album," she explains. "Jeremy is really good at structuring the songs and sequencing, but also adding parts to finish the song and make it better. The way that we usually start is that I bring him ten different ideas, like a verse, chorus, verse and a drum pattern and chord structure, but not quite there yet. But we mostly work independently. I did all of my vocals in my own studio. That's one thing we learned from the first album — it doesn't work when we're doing vocals in the same room, because we get irritated with one another, so it's just better if I do it. But we mixed all of the tracks at Jer's studio with our friend David Psutka, who goes by the name of <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/egyptrixx" target="_blank">Egyptrixx</a>."<br/>
 <br/>
You can find dates for Lanza's upcoming North American tour <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/jessy_lanza_takes_on_no_on_north_american_headlining_tour">here</a> and have a listen to <em>Oh No</em> below.<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[Anthony Jeselnik - Thoughts and Prayers]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/Anthony_Jeselnik_thumb.jpg' alt='Anthony Jeselnik - Thoughts and Prayers' /><br/><br/><em>Exclaim! is </em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/comedy/article/standup_comedy_review_marathon_launched_by_exclaim" target="_blank"><em>reviewing every standup comedy special currently available on Netflix Canada</em></a><em>, including this one. You can find a complete list of reviews so far </em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/comedy/netflixmarathon" target="_blank"><em>here</em></a><em>.</em><br/>
<br/>
Anthony Jeselnik is a relatively new face in American television. The self-stylized provocateur has scaled the ladder from late-night comedy writer to TV host through six years of hard work, bad taste and self-righteous sermons. His first special, <em>Thoughts and Prayers</em>, debuted in October 2015, and as far as introductions go, Jeselnik is about as ham-fisted as a pig made of fists.<br/>
 <br/>
While Jeselnik's special is not without its funny moments, the first 15 minutes are difficult — nay, excruciating — to watch, to say the least.  To be fair, Jeselnik probably has no intention of making his stage persona at all likable. He is arrogant, bent on breaking the world record for the number of times one can state opposition to political correctness on camera. One would hope that while portraying a caricature so detestable, Jeselnik would be able to compensate with his delivery, wit or timing. No such luck in the first quarter of this. With nearly every gag preceded by the phrase "and for my next joke" or some other equivalently extraneous mouth-fart, his introduction was reminiscent one of a down-on-his-luck magician — tacky and out of touch.<br/>
 <br/>
His early jokes are also juvenile without the saving grace of anything particularly ridiculous or unexpected being said, prompting implicit punch lines such as "Because domestic abuse is widely frowned upon!" or "Because projectile rocks are harmful to small infants!" And it's no laughing matter, there may well be a reasonably clever ten-year-old in an L.A. schoolyard who wants his jokes back.<br/>
 <br/>
If you possess the mental and moral fortitude to withstand the cringe-worthy first quarter of <em>Thoughts and Prayers</em>, it might be worth hanging on for another 15. A little comic relief has never been more needed. Jeselnik comes into his own for a surprisingly well-written and delivered 20 minutes of genuinely funny, clever and dark material. He seems to become a little less insufferable in spite of himself when given some decent material to work with. His jokes are often pointed, at times even multi-layered. Though not without a few clunkers, this middle tirade of <em>Thoughts and Prayers </em>nearly saves the special.<br/>
 <br/>
Having gathered some steam, Jeselnik takes the leap from comedy club to pulpit. He begins pontificating on why he loves telling jokes, why comedy is important personally, politically and socially. However, what starts off as mildly interesting if not necessarily that funny soon dissolves into almost 15 minutes of self-serving preaching with only rare glimmers of anything substantially funny, memorable or vital.<br/>
 <br/>
Jeselnik's <em>Thoughts and Prayers </em>is regrettably a train wreck, with a few brief sparks of ingenuity and all too few genuine chuckles. Watch the middle if you must; watch the rest at your peril.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/ExclaimCaAllArticles/~4/BCZNtg5HobY" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[http://exclaim.ca/comedy/article/anthony_jeselnik-thoughts_and_prayers]]></guid>

<title><![CDATA[Matthew Herbert Scores 'Nude' Project with the Gross Sounds of a Human Body]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/herbertcoverthum.jpg' alt='Matthew Herbert Scores 'Nude' Project with the Gross Sounds of a Human Body' /><br/><br/><a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/matthew_herbert">Matthew Herbert</a> has often thought outside of the box, like when he pressed up an <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/matthew_herbet_serves_up_edible_sounds_with_new_tortilla_record">edible tortilla record</a> earlier this year, or when he used a porcine life-cycle to score his controversial <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/matthew_herbert-one_pig"><i>One Pig</i></a> project. The UK sound experimenter has apparently gone au naturel for his next release, which samples all the crazy sounds associated with the human body. <br/>
<br/>
Herbert's <i>A Nude (The Perfect Body)</i> arrives July 1 through <a href="http://accidentalrecords.com/" target="_blank">Accidental Records</a>. It's explained in a press release [via <a href="http://pitchfork.com/news/65409-matthew-herbert-records-nude-body-sounds-for-new-album/" target="_blank"><i>Pitchfork</i></a>] that the sound artist recorded the sounds of a naked body over the course of 24 hours, with the goal to present "a musical nude in its purest form."<br/>
<br/>
The album tracks the nude as it "eats, sleeps, washes, wees, trims, wanks, moves, poos and so on." The record is pretty frank with revealing what all is going on in each track, with titles including "is sleeping," "is coming," and "is shitting." One could assume this is a natural progression for an artist that once issued an album called <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/matthew_herbert_announces_bodily_functions_reissue_new_box_set"><em>Bodily Functions</em></a>.<br/>
<br/>
Though the tracklist can be seen down below, samples from the set have yet to be released. That'd be its cover art up above.<br/>
<br/>
<em>A Nude (The Perfect Body)</em>:<br/>
<br/>
1. is sleeping<br/>
2. is awake<br/>
3. is grooming<br/>
4. is hurting<br/>
5. is eating<br/>
6. is moving<br/>
7. is coming<br/>
8. is shitting<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Swans' Thor Harris Steps Out with New Thor & Friends Project]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/thorandfriendsthum.jpg' alt='Swans' Thor Harris Steps Out with New Thor & Friends Project' /><br/><br/>With <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/Swans">Swans</a> due to drop their <a href="http://exclaim.ca/Music/article/swans_announce_live_lp_plans_to_record_final_album">"final album"</a> in their current iteration next month, longtime percussionist Thor Harris has revealed his next step. The bell-whapper has collected a group of pals to record under the name <a href="https://www.facebook.com/thorandfriends/?fref=ts" target="_blank">Thor & Friends</a>.<br/>
<br/>
Details are still developing, but <em><a href="http://pitchfork.com/news/65410-swans-thor-harris-readies-album-with-new-band-thor-friends/" target="_blank">Pitchfork</a> </em>reports that Harris has assembled a rotating cast of Austin, TX-based musicians for the project. This includes Peggy Ghorbani, Sarah "Goat" Gautier and more. A picture of Harris and his collected chums was posted by the marquee musician earlier today (May 11) through his <a href="https://twitter.com/thorharris666/status/730461430340718592" target="_blank">Twitter account</a>.<br/>
 
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en">
<p dir="ltr" lang="en">Thor&Friends <a href="https://t.co/ZdPUuZxfqp">pic.twitter.com/ZdPUuZxfqp</a></p>
— thor harris (@thorharris666) <a href="https://twitter.com/thorharris666/status/730461430340718592">May 11, 2016</a></blockquote>
<script async src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script><br/>
The band have already tracked a full-length, which will be released through <a href="http://lmduplication.com/" target="_blank">LM Music Duplication</a> sometime in the fall. No word yet on how many songs will appear on the album, but it was recorded in Albuquerque, NM, with A Hawk & A Hacksaw's members Jeremy Barnes and Heather Trost, as well as Deerhoof's John Dieterich.<br/>
<br/>
As for Swans, the band's <i>The Glowing Man</i> sees release June 17 through <a href="http://younggodrecords.com">Young God Records</a>/<a href="http://mute.com/" target="_blank">Mute</a>. Band leader Michael Gira had previously explained that he was retiring the longtime lineup of himself, Harris, guitarist Norman Westberg, pedal steel player Kristof Hahn, drummer Phil Puleo and bassist Christopher Pravdica. The group will continue with Gira leading "a revolving cast of collaborators."<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Lucius - The Imperial, Vancouver BC, May 10]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/DSC_0375_copysm_2.jpg' alt='Lucius - The Imperial, Vancouver BC, May 10' /><br/><br/>The warmth of the Imperial, its tasselled curtain backlit in pink and emblazoned with <em>Lucius</em>, welcomed the Brooklyn five-piece last night (May 10), the venue comfortably full with an older crowd.<br/>
 <br/>
Lucius lead singers Jess Wolfe and Holly Laessig made their entrance in their trademark matching style and attire — blonde bobs, red capes and dresses peppered with lightning bolts, metallic pink tights — and launched into "Madness," the first track off the band's latest release, <em>Good Grief.</em> The lithe gait and mournful air of the opener easily slipped into "Tempest," with seamless vocal switch-offs between Wolfe and Laessig, and taut playing by guitarist Andrew Burri and drummer Dan Molad who were surrounded by percussion setups on opposite ends of the stage.<br/>
 <br/>
The intimate play between Wolfe and Laessig was incredible, the two feeding off each other throughout the performance, entirely in sync. During "Almost Makes Me Wish For Rain," the duo moved away from their instruments, coming together front and centre, face to face to harmonized so beautifully and powerfully you could feel the weight of it. It was the tracks from <em>Good Grief </em>that garnered the most crowd response, the pop-heavy release quite distinct from the folk-pop musings of their acclaimed first album <em>Wildewoman</em>.<br/>
<br/>
The vocal prowess and unrivalled harmonizing of Wolfe and Laessig made the performance, demonstrated best on "Did You Find Love." While all members harmonized in a moment of hazy reverb, the duo moved stage right, a single microphone between them, their bodies mere feet apart as their vocals filled the space, the crowd in absolute rapture.<br/>
 <br/>
Despite not having much crowd interaction, the band's energy and enjoyment was palpable, as was their hold over the audience. Absolute silence fell in the middle of "Dusty Trails" — not a sound from the crowd, not a note produced by instruments, just the power of vocals stretched overhead. That intimacy was juxtaposed with the brashness of the next song, "Born Again Teen," which followed like a swift right hook.<br/>
<br/>
A departure of the duo from stage had the band start a lengthy looped intro to "Almighty Gosh," mystery vocals finally piped in as the crowd looked around confusedly, only to find Wolfe and Laessig among them, perched atop a set of stairs at the back of the venue. They made their way through the audience as if in a protective bubble, the crowd creating space in unison as they passed through, stopping in the middle to dance and close out the track.<br/>
 <br/>
Their return to the stage saw them perched on the edge, with guitarist Burri expressing humble thanks to their fans for their support, and keeping position to deliver an intimate rendition of "Two of Us on the Run," the band quietly filling in the silence, hitting their stride at the end. Surprisingly, the biggest crowd response — in the form of rapt attention and every lyric sung — was during "Go Home," the twangy crooner off their first album, which dripped with heartache and sweetness.<br/>
 <br/>
The first song of their encore featured just Wolfe, Laessig and opener Margaret Glaspy on guitar, huddled sweetly around a microphone to belt out — surprise — "Can't Help Falling in Love." It was a beautiful, tender moment that had the crowd silent and swaying until the last refrain, when they all joined in. To close off the show the band launched into B-side "Genevieve," wood block-abundant and with unrivalled enthusiasm, to the crowd's delight and surprise. You'd be hard pressed to find a band that has more fun onstage.<br/>
 <img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/ExclaimCaAllArticles/~4/qVW6TVqEV4M" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[http://exclaim.ca/music/article/lucius-the_imperial_vancouver_bc_may_10]]></guid>
<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/ExclaimCaAllArticles/~3/qVW6TVqEV4M/lucius-the_imperial_vancouver_bc_may_10</link>
