<title><![CDATA[Metronomy Announce 'Summer 08' LP, Team Up with Mix Master Mike on New Single]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/metronomyam.jpg' alt='Metronomy Announce 'Summer 08' LP, Team Up with Mix Master Mike on New Single' /><br/><br/>British electro-pop crew <a href="http://www.metronomy.co.uk/" target="_blank">Metronomy</a> released their <a href="http://exclaim.ca/Reviews/PopAndRock/metronomy-love_letters_2"><i>Love Letters</i></a> back in 2014, and now they're set to deliver the goods on another new LP.<br/>
<br/>
The album is called <em>Summer 08</em>, which is set to arrive on July 1 via <a href="http://www.because.tv/en/" target="_blank">Because Music</a>. Speaking with Annie Mac on BBC Radio 1, Metronomy leader Joe Mount said that he recorded the album in two weeks.<br/>
<br/>
Fortunately, to whet our appetites until the full platter, the band have shared a funky new single called "Old Skool." It features turntablism from Beastie Boys collaborator Mix Master Mike.<br/>
<br/>
Stay tuned for more on <em>Summer 08</em> as we approach its release. Until then, you can listen to "Old Skool" below.<br/>
<br/>
<strong>UPDATE (5/12, 12 p.m.): Metronomy have also shared a video for "Old Skool," as well as given us the tracklist for the record. As you'll notice, the album will feature Robyn on a song called "Hang Me out to Dry." </strong><br/>
<br/>
<em>Summer 08</em>:<br/>
<br/>
1. Back Together<br/>
2. Miami Logic<br/>
3. Old Skool (with Mixmaster Mike)<br/>
4. 16 Beat<br/>
5. Hang Me Out To Dry (with Robyn)<br/>
6. Mick Slow<br/>
7. My House<br/>
8. Night Owl<br/>
9. Love's Not an Obstacle<br/>
10. Summer Jam<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Thee Oh Sees Reveal New Live Album]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/ohseessanfranthum.jpg' alt='Thee Oh Sees Reveal New Live Album' /><br/><br/>Following earlier <i>Live in San Francisco</i> entries from artists including <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/ty_segalls_fuzz_sign_up_for_castle_face_records_live_in_san_francisco_series">FUZZ</a>, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/News/castle_face_records_debut_live_in_san_francisco_series_with_white_fence_concert_release">White Fence</a> and the Ty Segall Band, <a href="http://www.castlefacerecords.com/" target="_blank">Castle Face Records</a> head honcho John Dwyer has announced that his <a href="http://exclaim.ca/Artists/thee_oh_sees">Thee Oh Sees</a> project will be the next outfit to contribute to the live album series.<br/>
<br/>
Thee Oh Sees' collection lands July 1 through Castle Face, and marks the first double-LP instalment in the <i>Live in San Francisco</i> series. It features 11 tunes captured over three concerts at Bay Area venue the Chapel. The records come house in a gatefold sleeve, which also includes a DVD of live footage shot by Brian Lee Hughes.<br/>
<br/>
With the tracklisting in mind, a handful were plucked from the group's 2015 release, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/Music/article/thee_oh_sees-mutilator_defeated_at_last_album_stream"><i>Mutilator Defeated at Last</i></a> ("Sticky Hulks," "Web," "Withered Hand"). Elsewhere, Thee Oh Sees perform material from 2013's <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/thee_oh_sees-floating_coffin"><i>Floating Coffin</i></a> ("I Come from the Mountain," "Tunnel Time"), <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/thee_oh_sees_announce_carrion_crawler_dream"><i>Carrion Crawler/The Dream</i></a> ("The Dream"), and oldie 7-inch tracks like "Tidal Wave."<br/>
<br/>
You'll find the full tracklisting info and a stream of the concert set's "Web" below, while the super sweat-soaked cover art, picturing Dwyer, can be seen up above.<br/>
<br/>
<em>Thee Oh Sees - Live in San Francisco</em>:<br/>
<br/>
1. I Come From the Mountain<br/>
2. The Dream<br/>
3. Tunnel Time<br/>
4. Tidal Wave<br/>
5. Web<br/>
6. Man in a Suitcase<br/>
7. Toe Cutter Thumb Buster<br/>
8. Withered Hand<br/>
9. Sticky Hulks<br/>
10. Gelatinous Cube<br/>
11. Contraption<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[Test Your Music Knowledge with Red Bull Music Academy's Album Art IQ Game]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/RBMACoverGameThumb.jpg' alt='Test Your Music Knowledge with Red Bull Music Academy's Album Art IQ Game' /><br/><br/>Before the era of portable devices and streaming services, cover art was considered a major part of experiencing a record. Now, <a href="http://www.redbullmusicacademy.com" target="_blank">Red Bull Music Academy</a> is looking to challenge your mind with a new game by celebrating some of music's iconic covers.<br/>
<br/>
Created alongside Los Angeles' <a href="http://folderstudio.com" target="_blank">Folder Studio</a>, the Album Art IQ game is built to test your knowledge of hundreds of iconic covers within the genres of hip-hop, electronic, metal and New York artists.<br/>
<br/>
The game lines up two covers per turn, which become significantly less pixelated as time passes. The goal is to pick the right one as quickly as you can to earn the maximum amount of points. Too many consecutive wrong answers will end your gameplay.<br/>
<br/>
Work your way to the top of the leaderboard by playing the incredibly addictive game <a href="http://daily.redbullmusicacademy.com/specials/2016-album-art-iq/#" target="_blank">here</a>.<br/>
<br/>
The Red Bull Music Academy is currently running in New York City until May 22.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/ExclaimCaAllArticles/~4/YPo9-4JG64I" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[http://exclaim.ca/music/article/test_your_music_knowledge_with_red_bull_music_academys_album_art_iq_game]]></guid>

<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/pkewS_2.jpg' alt='Pkew Pkew Pkew Reveal North American Tour, Share "Asshole Pandemic"' /><br/><br/>Rowdy Toronto outfit <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/pkew_pkew_pkew_gunshots">Pkew Pkew Pkew</a> announced back in March that they had <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/pkew_pkew_pkew_return_with_new_album">readied their first LP</a> for <a href="http://royalmountainrecords.com/" target="_blank">Royal Mountain Records</a>, set for a June release. Now, the band have rolled out a North American tour in support of the album.<br/>
<br/>
The string of tour dates finds the group supporting Milwaukee pop-punks Direct Hit! this July, following a tour in June alongside PUP. Throughout the trek, they will play several Ontario shows, and you can see the complete itinerary below.<br/>
<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[Will Ferrell, Catherine Keener, Michael Cera Join Sebastian Silva's 'Captain Dad']]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/willferrellmichaelcerasm.jpg' alt='Will Ferrell, Catherine Keener, Michael Cera Join Sebastian Silva's 'Captain Dad'' /><br/><br/>Director Sebastian Silva has assembled an all-star cast for his next motion picture. Called <em>Captain Dad</em>, the film will star Will Ferrell, Catherine Keener and Michael Cera.<br/>
<br/>
According to <a href="http://deadline.com/2016/05/will-ferrell-catherine-keener-michael-cera-captain-dad-protagonist-cannes-1201751514/"><em>Deadline</em></a>, <em>Captain Dad</em> follows a family who go on a trip through the Caribbean on a sailboat. Ferrell and Keener play the parents, while Cera plays one of their daughters' love interests.<br/>
<br/>
As the titular boat patriarch, however, Ferrell's Rich Peelman is overconfident in his sailing abilities, and causes a great deal of stress for his family while they navigate the open sea.<br/>
<br/>
This will mark Cera's third time working with Silva, following <i>Crystal Fairy </i>and <em>Magic Magic</em>. The prolific director's most recent project was last year's <em>Nasty Baby</em>, which starred Kristen Wiig.<br/>
<br/>
Stay tuned for more on <em>Captain Dad</em> as it becomes available.<br/>
<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[You Can Now Get Your Very Own Slayer BMX Bike]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/slayerbalancethum.jpg' alt='You Can Now Get Your Very Own Slayer BMX Bike' /><br/><br/>Thinking of how to head out to one of <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/slayer">Slayer</a>'s <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/slayer_take_anthrax_and_death_angel_on_fall_north_american_tour">upcoming gigs</a> in the most twisted, slaytanic way possible? Well, the thrash greats have given you a co-signed option in the form of their new signature line of bikes.<br/>
<br/>
The already well-merchandised metal outfit have partnered up with bike company <a href="http://subrosabrand.com/" target="_blank">Subrosa</a> to produce the "Cradle to Grave" series of bikes, which comprises three BMX frames and one Urban Terrain Bike model. These all come adorned with blood red paint jobs, with the band's infamous sword-and-eagle logo grafted onto the front of the frame.<br/>
<br/>
While that sounds pretty evil, it should be noted that the pedal-less, 12-inch balance BMX model (pictured above) is described as offering "a safe, fun, and stylish journey" for young riders.<br/>
<br/>
"BMX has always had love for metal," Subrosa brand manager Ryan Sher said in a statement. "Whether it's in the headphones of riders ripping through town, background music during a contest run, or the soundtrack to some of the most famous and influential video parts, Slayer has been a huge piece of it all."<br/>
<br/>
The bikes are set to hit retailers this October, meaning Slayer fans of all ages can expect to bust out mandatory Suicide no-handers, aggression-fuelled Decades, and criminally insane Crankflips by the fall. If you're looking to show no mercy to the streets on a custom Slayer bike, you can find out more info on the frames over <a href="http://shop.subrosabrand.com/category/subrosa-x-slayer.html" target="_blank">here</a>.<br/>
<br/>
Interestingly, these aren't the only Slayer-sponsored modes of transportation over the years. Several band-themed skateboards have popped up, while a truly bone-chilling cross-promotion with Scion in 2014 delivered us the <a href="http://www.metalinsider.net/metal-on-metal/heres-a-better-look-at-the-slayer-scion" target="_blank">"Slayer Mobile."</a><br/>
<br/>
As previously reported, Slayer just announced another leg of dates behind last year's <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/slayer-repentless">Repentless</a></em> album. The trip will find them hitting various Canadian venues with Anthrax and Death Angel. You'll find the details over <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/slayer_take_anthrax_and_death_angel_on_fall_north_american_tour">here</a>.<br/>
<br/>
<iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="480" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jqduxsQ8WVs" width="854"></iframe> announced they're coming back to Canada on their next leg of dates supporting 2015's thrashed-out <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/slayer-repentless">Repentless</a></em><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/ExclaimCaAllArticles/~4/mjK5b2qGxSs" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
<guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[http://exclaim.ca/music/article/you_can_now_get_your_very_own_slayer-brand_bike]]></guid>
<link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/ExclaimCaAllArticles/~3/mjK5b2qGxSs/you_can_now_get_your_very_own_slayer-brand_bike</link>
<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 14:47:00 -0400</pubDate>
<author>editorial@exclaim.ca (Gregory Adams)</author>
<feedburner:origLink>http://exclaim.ca/music/article/you_can_now_get_your_very_own_slayer-brand_bike</feedburner:origLink></item>
<item>
<title><![CDATA[Pearl Jam Reissue 'No Code' and 'Yield' on Vinyl]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/PearlJamReissuesThumb.jpg' alt='Pearl Jam Reissue 'No Code' and 'Yield' on Vinyl' /><br/><br/>Though we've learned that <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/pearl_jam_and_beyonc_s_cover_of_redemption_song_to_get_holiday_single_release">a holiday single</a> from the band is on the way later this year, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/pearl_jam" style="line-height: 20.8px;">Pearl Jam</a> have lifted the curtain on some more vinyl goodies they have in store. Having been long out of print since their respective releases, the band are giving 1996's <em>No Code </em>and 1997's <i>Yield </i>the vinyl reissue treatment this summer.<br/>
<br/>
Listings on the band's <a href="http://pearljam.com/goods/index.php?cPath=11" target="_blank">web store</a> indicate that both records will be pressed on 150-gram wax, marking each album's return to the format since their release. The two were also both mastered for vinyl by Bob Rock and come in sleeves recreated from their original packaging. <em>No Code</em> even comes with the set of nine random replica Polaroids/lyric cards.<br/>
<br/>
As of press time, the average price that original U.S. pressings of <i>Yield </i>have sold for on <a href="https://www.discogs.com">Discogs</a> is $177.82 CA, while the four different variants of <em>No Code</em> range anywhere from $200 to $300 or more.<br/>
<br/>
Both reissues are available for pre-order through the band <a href="http://pearljam.com/goods/index.php?cPath=11" target="_blank">here</a> and set to arrive on August 5.<br/>
<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson Promises to Honour Robin Williams with 'Jumanji' Reboot]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/therockjumanjism.jpg' alt='Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson Promises to Honour Robin Williams with 'Jumanji' Reboot' /><br/><br/>There's no denying that Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson is the most lovable muscleman working today (sorry, Vin Diesel). With his alluring charisma, iconic eyebrows and chiselled chest, he manages to rise above even the worst movie ideas. That said, fans are questioning whether he can save a <em>Jumanji</em> reboot.<br/>
<br/>
Sure, The Rock is going adaptation crazy with forthcoming film projects like <a href="http://exclaim.ca/film/article/zac_efron_joins_dwayne_rock_johnsons_baywatch_reboot"><em>Baywatch</em></a>, <a href="http://exclaim.ca/film/article/dwayne_rock_johnson_to_star_in_adaptation_of_rampage_videogame"><em>Rampage</em></a> and maybe even a new version of <a href="http://exclaim.ca/film/article/dwayne_rock_johnson_in_talks_for_big_trouble_in_little_china"><em>Big Trouble in Little China</em></a>. But can he really do justice to material first popularized by the late, great Robin Williams?<br/>
<br/>
Since he's so damn charming, The Rock has decided to give these doubts <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XBgHHcAzhdE">the people's elbow</a> with a statement. In an Instagram post, available below, he promised to honour the memory of Williams. <br/>
<br/>
"An important thing that I want to be honest and bring up is Robin Williams," the CFL player turned wrestler turned actor wrote. "The love and respect I have for this man is boundless. "You have my word, we will honor his name and the character of 'Alan Parrish' will stand alone and be forever immortalized in the world of <em>JUMANJI</em> in an earnest and cool way. I have an idea of what to do and I think his family will be proud."<br/>
<br/>
The Rock also looked back on an encounter he had with Williams. "I also think Robin is somewhere lookin' down and laughing, remembering the first time we met backstage and I (for the first time ever) was a star struck bumbling idiot that couldn't even get my words out. Idiot," he wrote of himself. "He literally calmed me down w/ that smile and laugh. But that's for another fun story down the road."<br/>
<br/>
The <em>Jumanji</em> reboot is being directed by Jake Kasdan (<em>Bad Teacher</em>). It's set to open on July 28, 2017.<br/>
<br/>
<blockquote class="instagram-media" data-instgrm-captioned data-instgrm-version="7" style=" background:#FFF; border:0; border-radius:3px; box-shadow:0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width:658px; padding:0; width:99.375%; width:-webkit-calc(100% - 2px); width:calc(100% - 2px);"><div style="padding:8px;"> <div style=" background:#F8F8F8; line-height:0; margin-top:40px; padding:39.7222222222% 0; text-align:center; width:100%;"> <div style=" background:url(data:image/png;base64,); display:block; height:44px; margin:0 auto -44px; position:relative; top:-22px; width:44px;"></div></div> <p style=" margin:8px 0 0 0; padding:0 4px;"> <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/BFMdpIHIhwN/" style=" color:#000; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px; text-decoration:none; word-wrap:break-word;" target="_blank">And the #JUMANJI magic begins. Excellent meeting with our director Jake Kasdan, producer Matt Tolmach, and our @SevenBucksProd team to work on our new re-imagining of this amazing story. I felt like in order to craft something cool we should begin where it all started. Award winning writer Chris Van Allsburg&#39;s source material of JUMANJI. Chris also wrote THE POLAR EXPRESS (later adapted by Robert Zemeckis and Tom Hanks) and has a very special &amp; magical way of storytelling. I&#39;m feelin&#39; good and confident stepping into these shoes as a producer as well as actor to bring you something great that you and your entire fam can enjoy. An important thing that I want to be honest and bring up is Robin Williams. The love and respect I have for this man is boundless. You have my word, we will honor his name and the character of &#34;Alan Parrish&#34; will stand alone and be forever immortalized in the world of JUMANJI in an earnest and cool way. I have an idea of what to do and I think his family will be proud. I also think Robin is somewhere lookin&#39; down and laughing, remembering the first time we met backstage and I (for the first time ever) was a star struck bumbling idiot that couldn&#39;t even get my words out. Idiot. He literally calmed me down w/ that smile and laugh. But that&#39;s for another fun story down the road. We got a great team assembled already over at our home base of SONY and now we build from here. Here&#39;s another fun part... in the original movie there were three big roles. In our new story there&#39;s now FIVE. Been so damn cool to see all my actor buddies push their projects aside so hopefully they can come play in our world. Should have cool casting announcements this week. Will keep you posted. #TheMagicBegins #JustPressStart #JUMANJI</a></p> <p style=" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;">A photo posted by therock (@therock) on <time style=" font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px;" datetime="2016-05-09T17:23:07+00:00">May 9, 2016 at 10:23am PDT</time></p></div></blockquote>

<title><![CDATA[Julianna Barwick - "Same" (video)]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/barwickthum_2.jpg' alt='Julianna Barwick - "Same" (video)' /><br/><br/>Coming off of the recent release of her <em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/julianna_barwick-will">Will</a></em>, ambient auteur <a href="http://www.juliannabarwick.com/">Julianna Barwick</a> has now grafted some beautiful yet unsettling images to the record's <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/julianna_barwick-same">"Same."</a><br/>
<br/>
The music video, directed by visual collaborator Zia Anger, juxtaposes the floating, trance-inducing sounds of "Same" against a perilous moment for a woman apparently caught up in a mystical windstorm. The video goes on to explore the relationship between her, an athlete and a slightly sinister character.<br/>
<br/>
"We've worked together now three times (two music videos, and one short film) and each time we do, our process becomes more playful, more intuitive, more exciting," Anger said of her relationship with Barwick. "By the time we shot the final scene the entire idea had morphed in to some sort of spirit. The cast and crew were laughing so hard we were crying, it was totally hysterical, one of the purest cinematic moments I have ever experienced both in front of and behind the camera."<br/>
<br/>
You can check out the whimsical video below.<br/>
<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Donald Trump Is More Hated Than Nickelback: Poll]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/TrumpNickelbackThumb.jpg' alt='Donald Trump Is More Hated Than Nickelback: Poll' /><br/><br/>A number of <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/student_conducts_study_on_hatred_for_nickelback">studies</a> have looked at the deep-seated hatred that humanity appears to have for Canadian rockers <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/nickelback">Nickelback</a>, but the latest reveals that another man recognized for his flowing blonde locks may actually be disliked more than Chad and the boys.<br/>
<br/>
A new national poll from <a href="http://www.publicpolicypolling.com/main/2016/05/gop-quickly-unifies-around-trump-clinton-still-has-modest-lead.html" target="_blank">Public Policy Polling</a> has determined that United States presidential candidate Donal Trump is indeed viewed less favourably than the Canadian band, as well as lice, root canals, hipsters, jury duty and the DMV.<br/>
<br/>
Reporting the results on <a href="http://www.msnbc.com/rachel-maddow/watch/trump-less-popular-than-lice-new-ppp-poll-682411587777" target="_blank">MSNBC</a> last night (May 10), Rachel Maddow assured viewers that the results were real. "To be fair, Mr. Trump only loses by single digits to some of these. I mean, he's running pretty close to Nickelback," she said. "Overall, this is a list of things you do not really want to be losing to."<br/>
<br/>
Maddow made sure to include some good news, saying stats show that the Donald did beat cockroaches and hemorrhoids. You can watch her break down the poll in the player below.<br/>
<br/>

<item>
<title><![CDATA[The Flaming Lips to Appear in 'X-Men '92' Comic]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/xmen92lipsthum.jpg' alt='The Flaming Lips to Appear in 'X-Men '92' Comic' /><br/><br/>The good people at <a href="http://marvel.com">Marvel Comics</a> have steadily been extending their reach into the music world and have now announced that psych princes <a href="http://exclaim.ca/artists/flaming_lips">the Flaming Lips</a> will appear in a forthcoming issue of the company's retro-modelled <i>X-Men '92</i> series.<br/>
<br/>
The comic book's sixth issue, which comes out in August, features a cross-promotional story line in which the X-Men show up at a Flaming Lips concert. The cover, as you can see up above, finds Wayne Coyne and the rest of the band staring at Wolverine, who has apparently just savaged robot bounty hunter Death's Head.<br/>
<br/>
"Being in an X-Men comic where they (the X-Men themselves) actually run security at one of our shows... I should have written a song about that," Coyne told <a href="http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7364637/x-men-92-flaming-lips-toadies-cover-art" target="_blank"><i>Billboard</i></a>. "I mean... before it really happened."<br/>
<br/>
The book, which throws Marvel's comic continuity back to the mutant superhero group's early '90s glory days, also features an appearance from alt-rock group the Toadies, who, at this point, would be two years away from delivering their 1994 breakthrough, <i>Rubberneck</i>.<br/>
<br/>
"As an X-Men fan since 1977 this is a dream come true," Toadies bassist Doni Blair said. "Five-year-old me would do a Kool-Aid spit take on this news."<br/>
<br/>
It's explained that <i>X-Men '92</i> co-writers Chris Sims and Chad Bowers had initially been joking around about the potential of an X-Men/rock world crossover, alluding to '90s-period comic stunts. Quickly, they decided to roll with the gag by reaching out to bands they had admired.<br/>
<br/>
"The Flaming Lips and The Toadies are two of my favorite bands, and each had a profound impact on my musical tastes growing up — <i>Rubberneck</i> for the Toadies, and <i>The Soft Bulletin</i> and really everything behind it for the Lips," Bowers said. "Getting to reference not just the bands, but the music and what those songs meant to us is pretty surreal, and unlike anything either of us imagined we'd be doing on <i>X-Men '92</i>. Now if we can just convince Marvel to let us keep [the Lips'] Steve Drozd on the team when this arc's over..."<br/>
<br/>
The Flaming Lips and Toadies cameo are just the latest music-geared cross promotion from Marvel. Last year, the company produced a number of <a href="http://exclaim.ca/Music/article/marvel_unveil_kendrick_lamar_raekwon_kool_keith-inspired_comic_book_cover">variant covers</a> in which heroes and villains restaged the covers of classic hip-hop albums. Even before that, rap outfit Run the Jewels had been <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/run_jewels_represent_on_marvel_comics_covers">celebrated</a> on covers of <i>Howard the Duck</i> and <i>Guardians of the Galaxy</i>.<br/>
<br/>

<title><![CDATA[TIFF Bell Lightbox to Screen 35mm Print of P.T. Anderson's Radiohead Video]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/Radioheadsm.jpg' alt='TIFF Bell Lightbox to Screen 35mm Print of P.T. Anderson's Radiohead Video' /><br/><br/>Before they delivered their 9th studio album <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/radiohead-a_moon_shaped_pool"><em>A Moon Shaped Pool</em></a>, English art rock act <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/radiohead-a_moon_shaped_pool">Radiohead</a> tapped beloved director P.T. Anderson (<em>Magnolia</em>, <em>There Will Be Blood</em>, <em>Inherent Vice</em>) to direct a video for <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/radioheads_reveal_new_album_release_date">"Daydreaming."</a> Beginning tomorrow, Toronto's TIFF Bell Lightbox will screen a 35mm print of the video.<br/>
<br/>
Prints of the piece have been floating around select cinemas in the United States, and now Canada will get in on the action as TIFF plans to screen it before select movies.<br/>
<br/>
Fortunately, they've been kind enough to provide a schedule. You can find all of the films that "Daydreaming" will screen at below, complete with ticketing links.<br/>

<title><![CDATA[Devon Welsh of Majical Cloudz Releases 'Down the Mountain' Collection]]></title>
<description><img src ='http://exclaim.ca/images/devonwelsh-sm.jpg' alt='Devon Welsh of Majical Cloudz Releases 'Down the Mountain' Collection' /><br/><br/><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/majical_cloudz_announce_split_preview_future_projects">Majical Cloudz</a> announced their <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/majical_cloudz_announce_split_preview_future_projects">split</a> earlier this year, but frontman Devon Welsh hasn't slowed down his creative output at all. He <a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/majical_cloudz_devon_welsh_releases_new_album_with_belave">resurrected Belave</a> for a new album just weeks after announcing the dissolution of Majical Cloudz, and now he's returned with a brand new solo offering.<br/>
 <br/>
He's shared eight new songs under the umbrella title <em>Down the Mountain</em>, though he's not calling it an album. Welsh released a statement explaining the latest music, which reads:<br/>
 <br/>
<em>This is a small collection of songs that were written at different times over the last two years. Some of them were written during the same time as </em><a href="http://exclaim.ca/music/article/majical_cloudz-are_you_alone_2">Are You Alone?</a><em> but did not end up on that album for one reason or another. Others were written and recorded for fun last summer.</em><br/>
<br/>
<em>I want to release all these songs because I like them a lot and since I am working on new music, my attention will inevitably go to that new music and these songs will be forgotten, and forgotten songs are sad.</em><br/>
 <br/>
<em>So this isn't an album, and it isn't an album of "new music", but it's a collection of older songs that I like and that I feel deserve to be released.</em><br/>
 <br/>
He also notes that if the recordings sound a bit rough, it's because he mixed and mastered the songs himself, but assures fans he's in the process of learning how to get better at the technical side of things.<br/>
 <br/>
Listen to the new collection of songs in the player below.<br/>
 <br/>
